holidays.name: National Chicken Dance Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the iconic and goofy Chicken Dance! This fun and silly dance is perfect for shaking loose and getting everyone laughing.
holidays.origin: Started by Al Norman, a Wisconsin band leader, it unofficially became a day to enjoy the catchy tune and quirky dance moves on May 7 each year.
holidays.funFact: The Chicken Dance was originally called 'The Birdie Song' and was created by accordion player Werner Thomas in the 1950s.

holidays.name: International No Diet Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to breaking free from diet culture! Celebrate body positivity and enjoy your favorite foods without guilt.
holidays.origin: Originated in 1992 by British feminist Mary Evans Young to raise awareness about the dangers of dieting and promote self-acceptance.
holidays.funFact: This day challenges diet industry norms and encourages people to embrace a healthy relationship with food and their bodies.

holidays.name: Be a Millionaire Day
holidays.description: Imagine all the fun you could have as a millionaire! This day encourages dreaming big about wealth and the possibilities it brings.
holidays.origin: An unofficial day to inspire people to think about wealth creation and financial goals â€“ no official founding body, but lots of dreamers celebrate it!
holidays.funFact: Many people use this day as motivation to start new financial habits or side hustles to reach millionaire status.

holidays.name: Asthma Canada Awareness Day
holidays.description: Raises awareness about asthma symptoms, triggers, and management to support those living with asthma.
holidays.origin: Established by Asthma Canada to educate the public and improve asthma care across the country.
holidays.funFact: Asthma affects over 300 million people worldwide, and May 7 helps spotlight better treatment and prevention.
